div1.p: Permission is sought to photograph the painting of Walter Reed recently completed by Miller. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from the Chief Clerk of the Surgeon's General's Office to N. M. Miller, [December 4], 1915
div1.p:
It is desired to have a photograph made of the
portrait of Major Walter Reed recently delivered by you at
the Walter Reed Hospital, and the Surgeon General directs me
to ask your permission to have it done.

631, Penna Ave n.w. Washington, D.C.
Dec. 3, 1915 Reply to letter from Mr.
John Wilson, Chief Clerk, S.G.O. of the
2nd inst. relative to having a photo-
graph taken of the portrait of Major
Walter Reed/m.C., recently delivered
to Walter Reed G.H., states that it
gives him much pleasure to consnet
to having it taken. Should there be
an extra copy, would be glad to re-
ceive one.

631 Penna Ave n.w. Washington, D.C.
Nov. 23, 1915 States that he has comple-
ted the portrait of Dr. Walter Reed,
and it has been viewed by Mrs Reed, and
her daughter and several others, and
all pronounce it very satisfactory etc
On Friday next I expect to deliver and
hang the portrait in the Walter Reed
G.H., where it will be a fine and last-
ing tribute to the memory of the great
benefactor; and I am proud and highly
pleased to have been able to succeed
in obtaining such a perfect likeness
of him. The price of the portrait as
I quoted before is $550. including the
frame, which Mrs Reed and I have alrea-
dy selected.
